intro: Macrocarpaea bogotana, commonly known as the Bogotá macrocarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests and mountainous areas. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it produces distinctive, elongated fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
